name: Xochipilli's Showdown
description:
Xochipilli's Showdown is a competitive two person keep-away game where you can sculpt your environment to your advantage! Dig underground or climb for the heights to keep yourself safe from your opponent, but be careful, they'll come for you when you least expect it!

Xochipilli's Showdown was a game made for RPI's Game Development 1 class in in two weeks using HaxeFlixel.  We were given two verbs and told to make a game where those were the primary actions. We got "Catch" and "Sculpt." Xochipilli's Showdown was made by Nicholas Smith, Zach Thompson, Leonardo Price, Alexander Francoletti, and Jordan Faas-Bush. Yes, Xochipilli's Showdown does alliterate.
